ngiemboon: Alyɛʼɛ́ línɔ̀ɔn gie mé tóŋo lê Paŋtekɔ̂d gÿo ńtó, á gwɔ́ gwɔ́, mbà megàŋakwò Yěsô cuʼté tàʼa jʉʼ metsèm.
en: When the day of Pentecost had arrived, they were all together in one place.

ngiemboon: Mé néŋe tà ńjúʼ, ejʉʼ fó tÿǒ lepwó ńzye lénʉʼʉ, ńnʉʼʉ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie ntʉ̀ fóm ne ńcʉa la, ńnʉʼʉ nʉʼʉ tà ḿbú ńjÿó ndá gie pɔ́ la néŋe wó.
en: Suddenly a sound like that of a violent rushing wind   came from heaven, and it filled the whole house where they were staying.  # 2:2 Ac 4:31; 16:26

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá tsɔ́ shúm kẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ lʉ́me mmɔ̌g la, éshʉ́ate ńtyé na wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: They saw tongues like flames of fire that separated and rested on each one of them.

ngiemboon: Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pú ńjÿó wɔ́b metsèm. Pɔ́ zye léshwóŋo meshwóŋè meláʼa ndyɛ̀ʼɛ, éshwóŋo páʼ Zẅìge nǎ tʉ̀ ngie pɔ́ shwóŋo púʼu.
en: Then they were all filled   with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in different tongues,  # 2:4 languages, also in v. 11 as the Spirit enabled them.  # 2:4 Mk 16:17; 1Co 12:10

ngiemboon: Á laa na mɛ̌ melyɛ̌ʼ, pà Yúndà pie é gÿo mekùʼ Ssé, mbà pɔ́ ka fó tsɛ̀ɛ metúm ntsèm, ńtó ńgwɔ́ Yelúzálèm.
en: Now there were Jews staying in Jerusalem, devout people from every nation   under heaven.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼ páʼ jʉʼ nʉʼʉ púʼu, ńnɔ́ɔnte ńtó ńcúʼte tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nùɔ. Á gwaa kʉʼʉ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ, á júʼ megàŋntúm lɔgɔ pɔ́ kwàʼ shwóŋe yɔ́b láʼ gie à fóo né wó, ńgɔɔn nò.
en: When this sound occurred, a crowd came together and was confused because each one heard them speaking in his own language.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa kʉʼʉ wɔ́b pɔ́ gíŋe ne saŋa nÿɔ́g ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pʉ̀a pie é shwóŋo lɛ̂, é té gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Ngalílîa metsèm gwɔ́ lê?
en: They were astounded and amazed, saying,   “Look, aren’t all these who are speaking Galileans?  # 2:7 Ac 1:11; 2:12

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ na pege cʉ́ʼʉ ńjúʼu, pɔ́ shwóŋo pɔ́ kwàʼ shwóŋe láʼ yé?
en: How is it that each of us can hear them in our own native language?

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é fóo Paate mbɔɔ pe Mendɛ́sè, ńgÿo pe Elam ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege jʉʼɔɔn. Mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é néŋe Mezopotamia lâ pie ée Jẅindê. Epʉ̀a Kapandɔ́sè mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Pôŋ lâ pʉ̀a na pàga ngwòŋ Áziya gwɔ́ pɔ́ ssé.
en: Parthians, Medes, Elamites; those who live in Mesopotamia, in Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

ngiemboon: Pa fó Filijʉ pɔ́ Paŋfili pɔ́ Egíbtò, pà fó Silɛne á na pàga ngwòŋ Libiya, pa fó Loma gwɔ́ pɔ́ ssé.
en: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya near Cyrene; visitors from Rome (both Jews and converts),

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b gwɔ́ pà Yúndà lyɛʼɛ́ nzyé, petsɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é la zẅíŋe nò Ssé pà Yúndà. Té tʉ́ pà fó Kelɛd lâ Arabi. Á gÿo lêkɔ́ pege metsèm júʼu kwàʼ na meshwóŋè mégè mie ée mentí mentí, páʼ pʉ̀a pɔɔn gɔɔn páʼ mefàʼ Ssé fáŋ púʼu?»
en: Cretans and Arabs #— #we hear them declaring the magnificent acts of God in our own tongues.”

ngiemboon: Á pú ńkʉʼʉ wɔ́b tɛʼ. Pɔ́ kwaŋ pɔ́ té cʉ́me, ńcʉ́ʼ sele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɔ́ ngie: «Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́?»
en: They were all astounded and perplexed, saying to one another, “What does this mean? ”

ngiemboon: Tá petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgẅe ngàŋakwò Yěsô gẅe, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Epʉ̀a pɛ̂ pʉ̌a melùʼ!»
en: But some sneered and said, “They’re drunk on new wine.”

ngiemboon: Piɛ pâ megàŋntúm ntsɔ̀b yémɔʼɔ́ leen ńké ńdu ssé. Piɛ lɔg kwàʼ ngyè tetʉ̂ ńgɔɔn né láʼ ngie: «Pi pà Yúndà, tà mbɔɔ mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie aa Yelúzálèm lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, pi zẅíʼte, n ge shwóŋo gẅí mmó gie áa yɛ̌.
en: Peter stood up with the Eleven, raised his voice, and proclaimed to them, “Fellow Jews and all you residents of Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and pay attention to my words.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pɔɔn kaa pʉ̌a melùʼ páʼ pi kwaŋa lɛ̂ wɔ́. Wɔɔn zɔɔn ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nèm lepfwɔʼɔ́ mbaʼámbaʼ.
en: For these people are not drunk, as you suppose, since it’s only nine in the morning.

ngiemboon: Anò gie Juwɛ̂, ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn zɔ̌ páʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ḿbumte.
en: On the contrary, this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel:

ngiemboon: À la gɔɔn ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn ngie:
en: And it will be in the last days, says God,

ngiemboon: Oon, mèŋ n ge táa ná mɛ̌ melyɛ̌ʼ,
en: I will even pour out my Spirit

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge láʼ gÿo ndàagyá nò kẅɛɛ lefaŋ.
en: I will display wonders in the heaven  above

ngiemboon: Alyɛʼɛ́ láʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge láʼ gwaa tó, lejÿɔ́g nèm zɔɔn sele síŋ, lejÿɔ́g saŋ sele mbaŋ páʼ metse la.
en: The sun will be turned to darkness

ngiemboon: À ké ńgwɔ́ púʼu, mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à gaʼte ńtóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à tsẅɛ́.”
en: Then everyone who calls

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Pa Ésàlayɛ, pi téŋe tuŋó gí, ńjúʼu nò yɔɔn gie mèŋ n gee ngɔ̌ɔn lɔɔn. Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzalɛd, aa páʼa ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie Ssé ka kwàʼ ńnyɛɛ mbwó pi ngie yé zɔ ka túmo yé. À ka lɔg páʼ à ka cʉa na yé, ńgÿo menò mɔɔnmɔɔn, ńgÿo ndàagyá, ńgíŋe ńnyɛɛ gẅí meliŋé menò ntí ntí. Tà pi cwoŋo ne ńzsé.
en: “Fellow Israelites, listen to these words: This Jesus of Nazareth was a man attested to you by God with miracles, wonders, and signs that God did among you through him, just as you yourselves know.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa nyìŋ gẅie mé la néŋe mbwó pi, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ e Ssé la láʼ ńkwaŋte ńzáb. Pi leen ńké gÿo patezsě Ssé kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ, ńzẅé yé.
en: Though he was delivered up according to God’s determined plan and foreknowledge, you used   lawless people to nail him to a cross and kill him.  # 2:23 Mt 26:24; Lk 22:22; 24:20; Ac 3:18; 4:28; 5:30

ngiemboon: Tá e Ssé la kyɛ́ʼte menkÿo legwé na yé, ńzíme yé mélàʼmie, á la zɔɔn ńtʉ páʼ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ legwé néŋe yé ndátsǎŋ.
en: God raised him up, ending the pains of death,   because it was not possible for him to be held by death.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńjúʼu nò gie fùɔ Ndavîd la gɔɔn ńtí yé, à la gɔɔn ngie:
en: For David says of him:

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn néŋe ńjúʼ mboŋó, ngyè lekág zɔ kẅɛɛ ncwò mèŋ.
en: Therefore my heart is glad

ngiemboon: mélàʼmie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ́ légwáʼa wɔ́ɔn láʼ mepfó wɔ́,
en: because you will not abandon me in Hades

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ka nyɛɛ wɔ́ɔn memánzsè mie n ge pfó mǒ tá tsẅɛ́.
en: You have revealed the paths of life to me;

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, pi zẅíŋ ngie n zyɛ́b zyɛ́b shwóŋo gẅí nò, á na mángʉanjʉʼ wege fùɔ Ndavîd. À la kwé, mé tuŋó yé tà lesyè sé ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ láʼ yɔɔn tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: “Brothers and sisters, I can confidently speak to you about the patriarch David: He is both dead and buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

ngiemboon: Táʼ à laa ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, ḿbiŋ ne ńzsé nò gie Ssé la kaʼa mbwó yé tà ńkʉa ngie yé Ssé ge láʼ gÿo, múɔ gẅie à kẅɛɛ na ngẅɛ̀ ye zɔ néŋe na leŋe lefùɔ yé.
en: Since he was a prophet, he knew that God had sworn an oath to him to seat one of his descendants   on his throne.  # 2:30 2Sm 23:2; Ps 132:11; Mt 22:43; Lk 1:32; Ac 1:8; Heb 11:32

ngiemboon: Á laa púʼu, mbà fùɔ Ndavîd tʉ́ njÿó ńzsé ngie Nzàʼnkÿo ge láʼ zíme na legwé. Áa yɛ̌ tá à la gɔɔn na Nzàʼnkÿo ngie: “E Ssé ka te gwáʼa yé, á zso láʼ mepfó wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké te zẅíŋ ngie à lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè wɔ́.”
en: Seeing what was to come, he spoke concerning the resurrection of the Messiah: He    was not abandoned in Hades, and his flesh did not experience decay.   # 2:31 Ps 16:10,# 2:31 Ps 16:10; Ac 2:27

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn Yěsô gẅie mèŋ n gɔɔn lɔɔn, e Ssé ka zíme yé na legwé, peg pɔɔn metsèm ne shwóŋo yɔɔn nò, á gwɔ́ nò gie peg ka gyá.
en: “God has raised   this Jesus; we are all witnesses of this.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka gÿo, á kwɔ́ʼ tà ńnéŋe na gwoŋó pwó yé Ssé yetʉ̀. Áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn, mbà Tá wé Ssé cʉmé Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a mbwó yé, á gwɔ́ páʼ yé Ssé la kaʼ. Ammó gie pi júʼu ḿbiŋe ńgyá lɛ̂, áa Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ŋwɛ́ gie Yěsô nǎ né pʉ̀a pé.
en: Therefore, since he has been exalted to the right hand of God   and has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit,  # 2:33 Jn 7:39; 14:26; 16:7,13 he has poured out  # 2:33 Ac 2:17; 10:45 what you both see and hear.

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ yé fùɔ Ndavîd léen ńké te tÿǒ lepwó kwɔ́ʼ. Tá ńké ńgɔɔn nò ńtí Nzàʼnkÿo ngie: “Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gɔ̌ɔn mbwó wɔ̀ɔn Ndè ngie: Néŋe na gwoŋó pwó yɔ́ɔn yetʉ̀,
en: For it was not David who ascended into the heavens, but he himself says:

ngiemboon: ńzẅíʼte tà n dáʼ ńdɔg megàŋmbù pú, ńgÿo ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mú.”
en: until I make your enemies your footstool.’   ,# 2:34–35 Ps 110:1; Mt 5:35; 22:44; Mk 12:36; Lk 20:42–43; Jn 3:13; 1Co 15:25; Heb 1:13

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, ngwòŋ ngẅɛ̀ ndá Ésàlayɛ, pi gẅiin lékwaʼ ńzsé mboŋó ngie, Yěsô gẅie pi ka kime yé na tÿǒnkǐ la, aa yé gẅie e Ssé ka lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo Ndè, ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo Nzàʼnkÿo.»
en: “Therefore let all the house of Israel know with certainty that God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Messiah.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a júʼu yɔɔn shwóŋè, á pú ńkúte wɔ́b tɛʼ. Pɔ́ zɛ́te Piɛ pâ petsɔ́ megàŋntúm ngie: «Mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌, tà peg ge gÿo lêkɔ́?»
en: When they heard this, they were pierced to the heart and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what should we do? ”

ngiemboon: Piɛ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Pi kúbe mà. Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ na pi zẅíŋ mé nuʼu yé ntse na lezíŋ Yěsô Keleto. Légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge lege menò tepòŋ mé, é náa mbwó yé. E Ssé leen ńké ńnáa Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a né pi.
en: Peter replied, “Repent   and be baptized,  # 2:38 Ac 8:12; 22:16 each of you, in the name  # 2:38 Ac 3:16; 15:14 of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

ngiemboon: Mélàʼmie eshúm sie e Ssé la kaʼ, à lɔ̌ɔn ńkaʼa mbwó pi, mbɔɔ mbwó gubé gí. À lɔ̌ɔn ńkaʼa mbɔɔ mbwó pʉ̀a pie é néŋe ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, é ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yege ge gÿo tóŋo wɔ́b.»
en: For the promise is for you and for your children, and for all who are far off,   as many as the Lord our God will call.”

ngiemboon: Piɛ la gíŋe ńcwoŋo ńgɔɔn nò mbwó pɔ́b lélɔg shwóŋo wɔ́b mmó gie à ne ńzsé na Yěsô, ńne ńkẅiŋte wɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi fó nùɔ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀ʼɔɔn mbà pɔ́ léen fʉa mánzsè, ńkẅɛ, ńzsé ngie pi ge tsẅɛ́!»
en: With many other words he testified and strongly urged them, saying, “Be saved from this corrupt   generation! ”  # 2:40 Dt 32:5; Mt 17:17; Php 2:15

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn la júʼu nò gie Piɛ gɔ̌ɔn, ńzẅíŋ, mé nuʼu wɔ́b ntse. Mé la nuʼ pʉ̀a ntse lyɛʼó tà ńgwaa ngwɔ́ pɔ́ gwɔ́ ntsáʼ tá. Pɔ́ kẅiʼi na nùɔ pʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: So those who accepted his message were baptized, and that day about three thousand people were added to them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtóo fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm té tsó, megàŋntúm zíʼi wɔ́b nò Ssé, ńne ńtemte ńnéŋe páʼ púɔ mémá la, ḿbúte ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, ḿbiŋe ńcúʼte sẅíŋte Ssé.
en: They devoted themselves to the apostles’ teaching,   to the fellowship, to the breaking of bread, and to prayer.  # 2:42 Ac 1:14; Heb 10:25

ngiemboon: Megàŋntúm la ne ńgÿo menò mɔɔnmɔɔn mbɔɔ pandàagyá. Pʉ̀a metsèm gyá púʼu, ńcʉ́ʼʉ ḿmɔɔn mɔɔn.
en: Everyone was filled with awe, and many wonders and signs were being performed through the apostles.

ngiemboon: Pazáb ntʉ́m na Yěsô metsèm la gẅiin pɔ́ tàʼ ntʉ́m, ńteme shúm sɔ́b tem.
en: Now all the believers were together and held all things in common.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn sẅiŋe metsetsáʼ mɔ́b mbɔɔ shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ nkáb ńtóo mé gabte ńná ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ páʼ e ge kuʼu na yé nò.
en: They sold their possessions and property and distributed the proceeds to all, as any had need.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ ngwòŋ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm, lelèʼe wɔb gwɔ́ ngie pɔ́ cúʼte ndá Ssé. Pɔ́ kúu mendá, ḿbúte ḿpfɛ́ɛ shúm, ńjÿó shúm léjÿó pɔ́ né lekág. Wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅiin pɔ́ ntʉ́m mbòŋo.
en: Every day they devoted themselves to meeting together in the temple, and broke bread from house to house. They ate their food with joyful and sincere hearts,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńguʼte Ssé tɛʼ. Aláʼa ntsèm kwoŋ yɔ́b ntí lenéŋè. Á gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a pie à gÿǒ pɔ́ tsẅɛ́, ńkẅiʼi nùɔ yɔ́b.
en: praising God and enjoying the favor of all the people. Every day the Lord added to their number   those who were being saved.  # 2:47 Ac 5:14; 11:24; 16:5; Rm 14:18
